title.en: Competition Law and Market Regulation in Digital Economy

type.en: Course with defence at the end
Course with defence at the end
Course with defence at the end

objectives.en: This course familiarises participants with the European Union competition law rules specialising on case practice of the European Commission, the case law of the European Union Courts and more recent and pertinent case law from some Member States concerning digital markets. This includes platform economy, software licencing, use of personal data and AI related tools in business practices etc. Additionally, the course delves into upcoming legislative initiatives of the European Union in relation to the digital transformation initiative, including legislation proposals for the Digital Services Act (DSA) and Digital Markets Act (DMA) with the emphasis on the market regulation part of these acts. The great variety of competition law related problems shall be analysed in combination with different legal topics to provide students with real-life problem-solving skills and a wider understanding of the functioning of the competition rules in digital markets.
objectives.et: Sellel kursusel tutvustatakse osalejatele Euroopa Liidu konkurentsiõiguse norme, mis on spetsialiseerunud Euroopa Komisjoni praktikale, Euroopa Liidu kohtute praktikale ning mõne liikmesriigi hiljutisemale ja asjakohasemale kohtupraktikale seoses digitaalsete turgudega. See hõlmab platvormimajandust, tarkvara litsentsimist, isikuandmete ja tehisintellektiga seotud vahendite kasutamist äritavades jne. Lisaks suunatakse kursus Euroopa Liidu tulevastesse seadusandlikesse algatustesse, mis on seotud digiülemineku algatusega, sealhulgas õigusaktide ettepanekutesse digiteenuste õigusakti (DSA) ja digiturgude õigusakti (DMA) kohta, rõhuasetusega nende õigusaktide osal turu reguleerimisel. Konkurentsiõigusega seotud väga erinevaid probleeme analüüsitakse koos erinevate õigusteemadega, et anda õpilastele tegelik probleemide lahendamise oskus ja laiem arusaam konkurentsieeskirjade toimimisest digitaalsetel turgudel.

independent_work.et:
The course shall include 2 marked multiple-answer tests on the first block.
* Test 1: test on competition law basics in digital economy, 
* Test 2: test on merger control

Third component of the final grade is an essay for the second block concerning market regulation. The students can choose between 3 given subjects for the essay. 

Active participation during seminars will be marked with up to 9 extra points, which form a part of the final grade. Participation in the compulsory seminars towards obtaining the points involves active participation and engagement in the discussions in person.

Test 1: test on competition law basics in digital economy - 10 points
Test 2: test on merger control - 10 points
Essay: market regulation - 30 points

Active participation in compulsory seminars may be rewarded with up to 9 points. For more information on the point system, please see "Assessment Results" below.

1.Legal essay

EXAMPLE:
Assessment criteria
-correctness of formalisation and compliance with the requirements;
-relevance and extent of references to legal acts, case law, other relevant documents;
-level of analysis, establishing connections, level of interpretation;
-logic and integrity of covering the subject.

E - the form is, in general, in compliance with the requirements and correct; references are minimal and insecure; the elements of analysis and independent interpreting are there; the coverage of the subject is, in general, logical, but the connections are full of gaps;

D - the form is in compliance with the requirements and, in general, correct; references are minimal, but relevant; the analysis and independent interpreting is understandable, but at times insecure; the coverage of the subject is logical and associated;

C - the form is in compliance with the requirements and correct; references are relevant and sufficient; analytical connections and interpretations are proper and there is certainty in creating connections; the treatment of the subject is logical, but there are some weaknesses from the point of view of the whole;

B - the form is excellent; the choice, amount and association of references with the text is very good; thorough analysis of connections and references; bold interpretation based on connections; the treatment of the subject as a whole is logical and smooth;

A - the form is excellent; the choice, amount and association of references with the text is creative; the depth of the analysis and the level of independent interpretation is remarkable; the connections are thorough-going and creative; the treatment of the subject is innovative and logical; the text is a remarkable achievement on the whole.


2.Multiple answer tests (Test 1 and Test 2)

E - 51-60%, at least 8 correct answers
D - 61-70%, at least 9 correct answers
C - 71-80%, at least 10 correct answers
B - 81-90%, at least 12 correct answers
A - 91-100%, at least 14 correct answers

description.et: Test 2: test on merger control - 10 points
Test 1: test on competition law basics in digital economy - 10 points
Active participation in compulsory seminars may be rewarded with up to 9 points. For more information on the point system, please see "Assessment Results" below.

grade_preconditions.et:
Compulsory in person participation in 3 seminars; at least 51% on 2 compulsory tests each, submission and positive score in legal essay. 

Participation in the compulsory seminars towards obtaining the points involves active participation and engagement in the discussions in person.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
